events.message: The insured reported a car accident that occurred last night involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' due to the involvement of a vehicle collision.
An insurance agent has been assigned to handle the case and contact the insured for further details about the car accident.
The insured received formal acknowledgment of the claim submission and was informed about the next steps.
The agent requested copies of the police report, vehicle registration, and photos of the damage to proceed with the investigation.
The insured submitted all requested documents including the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and the other driver's insurance details.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and began contacting witnesses for statements regarding the vehicle collision.
The investigation concluded with a determination that the insured was not at fault in the auto accident and damages were verified.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental car expenses was proposed to the insured based on the investigation findings.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the timely resolution and clarity of the settlement proposal after the vehicle accident claim.
The claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement by the insured with no further disputes.
The approved reimbursement payment for car repairs and associated costs was issued to the insured's designated account.
The claim file was closed after successful payment and confirmation that the insuredâ€™s vehicle was repaired satisfactorily.
All case documents and correspondence were archived for record-keeping in compliance with company policies on auto accident claims.
